conclusion: The problem involves determining the maximum value of the electromotive force (EMF) generated by an AC generator with given parameters: number of turns m = 100, resistance r = 10 Ω, resistance R = 90 Ω, and magnetic flux variation with time t.
From the figure, the maximum magnetic flux is given as Φ_max = 2.0 × 10^-2 Wb.
The time period T from the figure is T = 6.28 × 10^-2 s.
The angular frequency ω is given by ω = 2π/T = 100 rad/s.
The maximum induced EMF E_max is given by E_max = m Φ_max ω = 200 V.
The back EMF in the coil is given by E_b = dΦ/dt.

premise: Φ(t) = Φ_max sin(ω t), ω = 100 rad/s.
conclusion: The rate of change of the magnetic flux is dΦ/dt = Φ_max ω cos(ω t).
The maximum value of the back EMF is E_b,max = Φ_max ω = 2.0 V.
The maximum EMF in the circuit is approximately the same as the maximum induced EMF, which is 200 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 200 V.
